posts.author: campgod
posts.content:
I was looking to build a high lvl Monk and trying to get Epic dodge and Self-concealment V. I am not a builder but I tried with this one and know there can be tweaks to the lvl progression to make it WAY better. I did read some of the guilds which helped. I tried a Monk26/Assassin9/SD5. On my server you can get +12 ability stuff and the Imp invisy is tweaked so you don't get the 50% concealment bonus, that's why I was trying to get in in the feats. I did see a few builds that looked close, like "The Inquisitor" and "drow Ninja" but was trying for more lvls in the monk class. I could only get Self-concealment III so I was wondering if there is something I can do to get the full V and If not is the Self-concealment III better than nothing or should I get rid of them and do different feats? Like I said I never really tried so I know its bad... Thanks for all the help I get though.



ALIGNMENT: Any Evil

Race: Elf

LEVELING GUIDE:

1-Monk, Dodge
2-Monk
3-Monk, Weapon Finesse
4-Monk
5-Monk
6-monk, Weapon Focus(unarmed strike)
7-Assassin

16-Assassin

38-Monk
39-Monk, Self-concealment II & III
40-Monk

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
Hey campgod! Nice to see you're still around NWN!

OK, let me tell you that this build you came up with is far from optimized. Have you read my guide to the basics of building characters? It would really help you if you understood how BAB progression works pre-epic, most specifically, THE RULE OF 4. Take a look at it, it's a LONG READ, but it's ABSOLUTELY WORTH YOUR TIME! Here's the link: Click Here

Now AFTER you read it, come back and continue reading this post, because before you'll have NO IDEA what I'm talking about.

The first problem I see is that you don't know your classes that well. Assassin in a build only works if you take many levels of it, because the main feature of the class is Death Attack, which has a DC (Difficulty Class) strongly linked to the number of levels in the class that you take. So if you want MANY Monk levels, I'd say the first thing that you need to do is remove Assassin from the build altogether.

For the purpose of Epic Dodge, you get Defensive Roll, and Improved Evasion at SD 5 and Monk 9 respectively, but for maximum amount of damage you need at least 16 Monk levels. So there we have it, Monk 16 / SD 5 are the minimum requirements to match your Epic Dodge goal. The EARLIEST you can take ED is at level 27th, so there is no rush to get there. You have 19 EXTRA levels to think of adding another class. The most obvious choice here would be Rogue, which gives a Bonus Feat at 10th level and every 3 levels thereafter, and with which you can take Self Concealment feats provided you meet the requirements. So, basically, here's what it boils down to:

Monk 16 / Rogue 19 / Shadowdancer 5. We have now our optimal spread. Next we define the PRE-EPIC SPREAD by following the rule of 4. Basically, you want as much Monk as possible pre-epic because of damage and bonus feats, you want at least 4 Rogue to have access to UMD and their skillset, and you want at least 4 SD to have HiPS (BUT NOT 5 SD BECAUSE IT COSTS YOU 1 BAB).

I'd say this character kind of builds himself now. Pre-epic spread is Monk 12 Rogue 4 SD 4. That way you'll get a BAB of 15 and have good playability throughout.

Next we look at the order. Start with Rogue for more Skill Points, then take levels of Rogue at 8, 13 and 18 for skill dumps.

Now, we already have Improved Evasion, so level 21 is SD, and we are now set to take Epic Dodge. You can take it with a Rogue Bonus Feat, saving general feats for Great Dexterity to faster achieve the Self Concealment requirements. All your general feats are Great Dexterity from now on, no EWF, no Armor Skin, you want to meet the requirements for SC as soon as possible, and 30 DEX is not easy to reach with 5 feats left to take SC with, so you need to sacrifice playability for it. All the levels you take now will be Rogue until you reach Rogue 10, and with that Bonus Feat you'll get Epic Dodge at the earliest possible level. Now you need to take Rogue levels and stop at 12, then take Monk levels until you reach 30 DEX, which will happen at 32nd level. So at 33rd you'll start taking SC, and only at 39th will you be able to take EWF.

OH, and the fact you're an elf means this build has XP penalty.

If you follow what I wrote, this is what you get:

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
If you want to build with assassin to avoid the XP penalty and like the paralysing death attack, here is a way to build an ED SCV character.
It is a bit fragile early on before you get the DA up some. The character can handle deadly traps (detect, recover and set).
The DA DC is 31 (I prefer it closer to 40, but that is hard to achieve if you want 16 monk levels for "big fists") and you deliver 2 death attacks from stealth, 3 if hasted and with flurry active. HIPS works well with assassins since you have an easy way to disappear and let the target resume the flat footed state, before you initiate a new paralysing death attack attempt.
The Stunning fist DC is 32. If you use that attack from stealth, you deliver 2 paralysing and 2 stun attempts with your first attack, and even 3 of each if hasted and with flurry active.

Monk(16), Shadowdancer(5), Assassin(19), Elf

DEX: 20 (32)
CON: 8

INT: 14

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
Mick, cool build, very similar to mine, but you should take HiPS pre-epic, you have the SD levels, why not take 4 pre-epic? Monk 8 Assassin 8 SD 4 is better than Monk 12 Assassin 8 IMO. Damage suffers, but you have Hips from level 8 on.

Take it EZ!

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
If you want to use Kamas, which normally is better than unarmed in a high magic environment, I have this build for you. It is a far better Assassin with more effective Death attacks and more attacks per round from the dual wielding of Kamas.

Monk(9), Shadowdancer(5), Assassin(26), Elf

STR: 8
DEX: 20 (32)
CON: 8
WIS: 14
INT: 14
CHA: 8

01: Monk(1): Dodge, {Cleave, Evasion, Improved Unarmed Strike, Stunning Fist}
02: Monk(2): {Deflect Arrows}
03: Monk(3): Weapon Finesse
04: Monk(4): DEX+1, (DEX=21)
05: Monk(5)
06: Monk(6): Mobility, {Knockdown, Improved Knockdown}
07: Assassin(1)
08: Shadowdancer(1): DEX+1, {Hide in Plain Sight}, (DEX=22)
09: Assassin(2): Weapon Focus: Kama, {Uncanny Dodge I}

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content: I may be biased, but I prefer the Kama one by A MILE! Nice going, Mick!

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
Maximillian Kane wrote:I may be biased, but I prefer the Kama one by A MILE! Nice going, Mick!
So do I, Max, but I'm afraid we are drifting far away from the high level monk the OP wanted!

(Btw. You were right about taking 4 levels of SD pre epic, also when going unarmed, but I'm sorry I don't have time to edit it now.)

posts.author: campgod
posts.content: Wow, I think my head is going to explode! Thanks guys for all the info and build ideas. I need to look each over and see which to go with. Hell I might just build them all and see which play style I like the best! As always you guys do not disappoint, thanks again to you both for your time and ideas. Another thing, do you guys thinking dropping one SC for epic prowess is a good idea or is the +2AB not worth the the 50% concealment. Playing this with a little PvP and sometimes people are hard to hit.

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content:
If your opponents have Blind Fight, and in PVP they will, they get a second chance if they miss a concealed opponent, so the miss chance from Concealment is squared, so 50% becomes 25%, 40% becomes 16%, 30% becomes 9%, 20% becomes 4%, and 10% becomes 1%, so it is not worth much to have only SC4.

Here is a whole different approach. I do not claim that it is better, but only that it is another option. The pluses: 1 more attack per round, 1 better AB and 1 better AC, +2 damage from Weapon Spec, and 41 Spell Resistance. The minuses: no sneak attack, fewer skill points, no Epic Prowess or Armor Skin.

I found out that there is no way to get Epic Weapon Spec and Epic Dodge and SC5. This build can have any 2 of these, but not all 3, so I made the hard choice and took only the 4 pre-epic levels of Fighter. Like the build with Rogue, this build has a 20% experience penalty, starting at level 15.

Anyway, Here's the build:

campgod wrote: Hell I might just build them all and see which play style I like the best!
Have you read my assassin guide? You will find some info on play style there.

posts.content: just read it. Lots of good info in there, thanks. Kinda makes me want to try a Ranger/Assassin soon. Thanks Empyre65 for the build, the fighter does add some nice touches to it.
